metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3556 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The STARTTLS implementation in mail/ngx_mail_smtp_handler.c in the SMTP proxy in nginx 1.5.x and 1.6.x before 1.6.1 and 1.7.x before 1.7.4 does not properly restrict I/O buffering, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to insert commands into encrypted SMTP sessions by sending a cleartext command that is processed after TLS is in place, related to a "plaintext command injection" attack, a similar issue to CVE-2011-0411.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3556` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

nginx - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3
nginx-common - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3
nginx-core - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3
nginx-extras - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3
nginx-full - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3
nginx-light - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3
nginx-naxsi - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3
nginx-naxsi-ui - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> per Debian, only affects 1.5.6 to 1.7.3

criterions.comment: nginx package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.6-1ubuntu3').
